facts.fact: The beaver is the second largest rodent in the world after the capybara
Officially declared in 1975, the beaver is considered an emblem of Canada
Beavers can chew underwater without getting water in their lungs, thanks to a special flap at the back of their mouths
A beaver's teeth never stop growing over the course of their lifetime
If a beaver ever feels threatened, it will slap its tail on the surface of the water to warn other beavers in the area
The world's longest beaver dam is found in Alberta's Wood Buffalo National Park and is almost 800 metres in length
A group of beavers is called a colony
Beavers get their theeth's orange color from an iron-rich protective coating of enamel
A beavers 'day' can be 26-29 hours due to their circadian rhythm
Beavers are primarily nocturnal and tend to be most active at night
Beavers can swim up to can swim as fast as almost 10 km/h
Beavers have a transparent third eyelid which protects their eyes when swimming underwater
